014package org.jdbi.v3.core;
015
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Collection;
018import java.util.Objects;
019import java.util.stream.Collectors;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 *   An immutable sql statement string created from multiple tokens
024 *   in order to write inline sql statements in an easy-to-read fashion
025 *   spread out over multiple lines of code.
026 * </p>
027 *
028 * <p>
029 *   The class implements {@link CharSequence} and thus can be used as a drop-in
030 *   alternative wherever API supports {@code CharSequence} rather than {@code String}.
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * Please note that the validity of the statement is never checked,
034 * and that {@code null} or empty inputs are permitted (no run-time exceptions).<br>
035 *
036 * The input of multiple tokens is formatted into a single String by
037 * removing leading and trailing whitespace and concatenating
038 * non-empty tokens by a single space character.
039 * Further, any trailing semicolons are removed from the resulting sql string.
040 *
041 * <p>Example:</p>
042 *
043 * <pre>
044 *     String tblName = "table";
045 *     Sql.of("SELECT COUNT(*)",
046 *            "FROM", tblName,
047 *            " WHERE cond1 = :cond1",
048 *            "   AND cond2 = :cond2");
049 * </pre>
050 *
051 * @author Markus Spann
052 */
053public final class Sql implements CharSequence {
054
055    /** The internal sql string. Cannot be null. */
056    private final String str;
057
058    private Sql(String sql) {
059        str = sql;
060    }
061
062    public static Sql of(CharSequence... tokens) {
063        return tokens == null ? new Sql("") : of(Arrays.asList(tokens));
064    }
065
066    public static Sql of(Collection<CharSequence> tokens) {
067        return tokens == null ? new Sql("") : new Sql(format(tokens));
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Formats an sql statement from multiple tokens.<br>
072     * Leading and trailing whitespace is removed from each token and empty tokens ignored.<br>
073     * The tokens are joined using a single blank character to create the sql string.<br>
074     * Finally, any trailing semicolons are removed from the resulting sql.
075     *
076     * @param tokens collection of tokens
077     * @return formatted sql string
078     */
079    static String format(Collection<CharSequence> tokens) {
080        String sql = Objects.requireNonNull(tokens).stream()
081                .filter(Objects::nonNull)
082                .map(CharSequence::toString)
083                .map(String::trim)
084                .filter(s -> !s.isEmpty())
085                .collect(Collectors.joining(" "));
086        while (sql.endsWith(";")) {
087            sql = sql.substring(0, sql.length() - 1);
088        }
089        return sql;
090    }
091
092    @Override
093    public int length() {
094        return str.length();
095    }
096
097    @Override
098    public char charAt(int index) {
099        return str.charAt(index);
100    }
101
102    @Override
103    public CharSequence subSequence(int start, int end) {
104        return str.subSequence(start, end);
105    }
106
107    @Override
108    public int hashCode() {
109        return str.hashCode();
110    }
111
112    @Override
113    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
114        if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
115            return false;
116        }
117        return str.equals(((Sql) obj).str);
118    }
119
120    @Override
121    public String toString() {
122        return str;
123    }
124
125}
